intro: Pecteilis praecox, commonly known as the early evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the late afternoon. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. The seeds are enclosed in a capsule and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ecological role in pollination and seed dispersal.
